required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Mechanisms of Endothelial Dysfunction in Type 2 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: Determination of the Mechanisms Involved in Conduit Artery Endothelial Dysfunction in Type 2 Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: Endothelial dysfunction of conduit arteries plays an important role in the development of cardiovascular complications associated with type 2 diabetes. In order to propose targeted therapeutic approaches, this study aim to determine the mechanisms involved in endothelial dysfunction of conduit arteries in these patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in EET concentration during endothelial stimulation
primary_outcome.time_frame: 30 min from the beginning of hand skin heating

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in NO concentration during endothelial stimulation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 min from the beginning of hand skin heating

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in ET-1 concentration during endothelial stimulation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 min from the beginning of hand skin heating

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in ROS concentration during endothelial stimulation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 min from the beginning of hand skin heating

arm_group.description: Assessing the availability of biological markers (NO, EETs, ET-1 and ROS) during endothelial stimulation using blood samples.
Assessing the availability of biological markers (NO, EETs, ET-1 and ROS) during endothelial stimulation using blood samples.
Assessing the availability of biological markers (NO, EETs, ET-1 and ROS) during endothelial stimulation using blood samples during hyperglycemia or hyperinsulinemia.

intervention.description: Blood samples will be performed at baseline and during endothelial stimulation by hand skin heating to quantify metabolites of NO, EETs, ET-1 and ROS

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type 2 diabetic patients or control subjects or healthy volunteers
Exclusion Criteria:
- Macroangiopathy
- Insulin treatment
- Chronic kidney disease (eGFR<60 ml/min/mÂ²)
- Hyperlipidemia (total cholesterol>2.5 g/l)
- Smoking habit > 5 cigarettes/day
- Pregnancy
